name: hydrolytic

relating to or involving hydrolysis (= a chemical reaction in which one substance reacts with water to produce another): More than one hydrolytic enzyme could be involved in the process. The hydrolytic loss of these pesticides in sea water suggests that these compounds will not be a long-term environmental problem.
More examplesFewer examplesHydrolytic activity might contribute to tissue damage.An extract obtained from the sperm showed hydrolytic activity.The water-soluble compound is produced during digestion by the hydrolytic breakdown of proteins.At the high temperatures used during frying, the oil can undergo hydrolytic splitting.
